hero.description: Practical guide to implementing privacy and cookies the right way: consent before analytics, accessible banner, clear policy, and respect for user choice. This site applies these practices; here you see what to consider for your project.
hero.warning: This guide is not legal advice. For full legal compliance, consult a lawyer or DPO in your jurisdiction.

overview.title: Overview
overview.subtitle: Why it matters
overview.description: Privacy and cookies aren't just red tape: they build trust, reduce legal risk, and improve experience when users have control. In the EU, GDPR requires explicit consent for non-essential cookies; similar principles apply in Brazil (LGPD) and elsewhere.

items.title: Trust
items.description: Users who see a clear notice and choice (accept/reject) tend to trust the site more.

items.title: Compliance
items.description: GDPR and LGPD require clear information, consent where applicable, and the right to withdraw.

items.title: Essential vs non-essential cookies
items.description: Essential cookies (e.g. language, session) usually don't need prior consent; analytics and marketing do.

items.title: Minimal data
items.description: Collect only what you need. Hashed IP, no third-party cookie, is more privacy-friendly than tracking cookies.

consent.title: Consent
consent.subtitle: Golden rules
consent.description: Consent must be free, informed, and unambiguous. Refusing must be as easy as accepting.

tips.title: Banner before non-essential scripts
tips.description: Don't load analytics (Google, Vercel, etc.) until the user accepts. No cookie = don't track.

tips.title: Two equally visible buttons
tips.description: Accept and Reject (or Essential only) both visible and accessible. Avoid dark patterns.

tips.title: Link to policy
tips.description: Learn more should go to the privacy page with what's collected, why, and how to revoke.

tips.title: Persist the choice
tips.description: Store in a cookie (e.g. 1 year) so you don't show the banner every visit. List this cookie in your policy table.

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.subtitle: What this site does
implementation.description: On this portfolio: cookie banner with Accept / Essential only; consent cookie; Vercel Analytics and own tracking (Redis) only after accept; privacy policy at /privacidade; revocation explained (delete cookie). You can inspect the code in the open repo.

points.title: Consent cookie
points.description: Fixed name and values (accepted/rejected). No personal data. Secure on HTTPS, SameSite=Lax.

points.title: Conditional scripts
points.description: Component that only renders analytics when hasAnalyticsConsent() === true. Same for ViewTracker.

points.title: Privacy page
points.description: Sections: what we collect, cookie table, analytics, third parties, rights, how to revoke.

checklist.title: Checklist
checklist.subtitle: Items for your site
items: Show a cookie notice on first visit (or until consent is given).
Offer explicit reject option (Essential only or similar).
Keep privacy policy up to date and linked in footer and banner.
Explain how to revoke (e.g. delete cookie, or link that clears and redirects).
Use Secure cookie in production (HTTPS) and appropriate SameSite.
Validate and sanitize any data you store (e.g. path in analytics) to avoid XSS/redirect.

cta.title: Next steps
cta.description: Review your project with the checklist above and ensure a clear privacy policy. To see the implementation in action, use this site's banner and privacy page as reference.
